_comment: Template for cache invalidation requests.  Use this to build your request to invalidate cached data.
A unique identifier for this invalidation request.  Helps with tracking and auditing.
The type of cache to invalidate.  Options: 'redis', 'cdn', 'http'.
Specifies what is being targeted for invalidation.  Options: 'key', 'tag', 'all'.
The specific cache key to invalidate (if target is 'key').
The tag to invalidate (if target is 'tag').  All entries with this tag will be invalidated.
If cache_type is 'cdn', specify the CDN provider. Options: 'cloudflare', 'akamai', 'fastly'.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'cloudflare', specify the Cloudflare zone ID.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'akamai', specify the Akamai Client Token.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'akamai', specify the Akamai Client Secret.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'akamai', specify the Akamai Access Token.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'fastly', specify the Fastly Service ID.
If cache_type is 'cdn' and cdn_provider is 'fastly', specify the Fastly API Key.
If cache_type is 'http', specify the HTTP header to modify.  Typically 'Cache-Control'.
If cache_type is 'http', specify the new value for the HTTP header.  Example: 'no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate'.
If true, invalidates all entries in the specified cache_type.  Use with caution!
Timestamp of the invalidation request. Useful for auditing and debugging.
User who initiated the invalidation request.
